parse.title: List of works produced by Filmation

text.*:
This is a list of animated television series, made-for-television films, direct-to-video films, theatrical short subjects, and feature films produced by Filmation. Note that some shows or new spin-offs of shows may be listed twice.

Contents

  • 1 Television series
    • 1.1 1960s
    • 1.2 1970s
    • 1.3 1980s
  • 2 Television films, shorts and specials
  • 3 Theatrical films
  • 4 References

Television films, shorts and specials[edit]

Title Airdate Network Notes Co-production
His Mother Marveled 1963 Syndication Family Films
Archie and His New Pals September 13, 1969 CBS
Hey, Hey, Hey, It's Fat Albert November 12, 1969 NBC Introduction to Fat Albert and the Cosby Kids
The Archie, Sugar Sugar, Jingle Jangle Show March 20, 1970 CBS
Aesop's Fables October 31, 1971 CBS Based on the fable of The Tortoise and the Birds and the fable of The Tortoise and the Hare. Lorimar Productions
The Brady Kids on Mysterious Island September 9, 1972 ABC Aired as part of The ABC Saturday Superstar Movie Paramount Television
Lassie and the Spirit of Thunder Mountain November 11, 1972 ABC Aired as part of The ABC Saturday Superstar Movie Lassie Television
Daffy Duck and Porky Pig Meet the Groovie Goolies December 16, 1972 ABC Aired as part of The ABC Saturday Superstar Movie Warner Bros. Television
The Fat Albert Halloween Special October 24, 1977 CBS
The Fat Albert Christmas Special December 18, 1977 CBS
Treasure Island April 29, 1980 NBC Produced in 1972; aired as part of NBC Special Treat series
A Snow White Christmas December 19, 1980 CBS
Oliver Twist April 14, 1981 NBC Produced in 1974; aired as part of NBC Special Treat series
The Fat Albert Easter Special April 3, 1982 CBS
Flash Gordon: The Greatest Adventure of All August 21, 1982 NBC King Features Syndicate
He-Man & She-Ra: A Christmas Special December 25, 1985 Syndication Mattel

Dick Digit and The Jester (1967) unaired pilot/promotional film

Title Release date Distribution Notes Co-production
Journey Back to Oz December 14, 1972 Produced in 1962; unreleased until 1974
Treasure Island 1973 Warner Bros.

Mighty Mouse in the Great Space Chase December 10, 1982 Filmation Viacom Productions

Pinocchio and the Emperor of the Night December 25, 1987 New World Pictures
BraveStarr: The Movie March 18, 1988 Taurus Entertainment Alternate title: BraveStarr: The Legend
Happily Ever After June 20, 1990 First National Productions Kel-Air Entertainment

References[edit]

  1. ^ "'Sesame Street' Breakthrough For New Programming". Florence Times—Tri-Cities Daily. Florence, AL. Associated Press. April 27, 1970. p. 2. Retrieved March 25, 2012. 
  2. ^ Kleiner, Dick (June 14, 1973). "New Animated TV Show Is Aimed At Adults". Portsmouth Times. Newspaper Enterprise Association. p. 21. Retrieved March 25, 2012. 
  3. ^ Margulies, Lee (May 12, 1975). "Filmation - its sole product is for kids". The Free Lance-Star. Fredericksburg, VA. Associated Press. p. 20. Retrieved March 25, 2012.
